message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.ST, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with information theory and statistical inference, which are typically covered in the sub-categories of Information Theory (cs.IT), Machine Learning (cs.LG), Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS), Statistics Theory (cs.ST), and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). The use of Bayesian methods and logarithmic Sobolev inequality suggests a focus on information theory and machine learning, hence cs.IT and cs.LG are the most likely sub-categories. However, the paper also deals with statistical inference and log-concave priors, which could place it in cs.ST and cs.DS. Finally, the mention of social networks in the abstract suggests a possible connection to cs.SI.
